intro: Gymnosporia rugulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf burr, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rough, often hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its fruit is a dry, hairy capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gymnosporia rugulosa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
